column4: How do I play wma files which the codec finder can't find codecs for?
use vlc
also install ubuntu-restricted-extras
I already have that installed - still no luck
so they might be corrupt or drm
they play in windows media player in virtualbox
Is there any way I can convert them so they can play in linux?
you can convert them, but if wma is supported, though there are many wma-formats, try handbrake
http://www.getdeb.net/updates/Ubuntu/10.04/?q=handbrake
vlc says the files a "wmal", and mplayer says they are 0x163 files. I will look at handbrake. thanks
I installed the handbrake package... is there any gui for the linux version? I don't see any and all the online documentation is for macs and windows :(
shall be under multimedia in your menu, or start handbrake from terminal
don't worry.. seems I installed the command line interface version by mistake
are you using 64 bit or 32 ?
64bit
should work with the getdeb version, but can also try the ppa:
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:gwibber-daily/ppa
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install handbrake-gtk
Thanks, I am right for installing it now.
ok... handbrake failed. could not open the audio stream of source file.
so only thing I can think of is use audacity to re-record it from the playing vm then ;-)
I think an easier solution is to find non-drm-nobbled versions off a file sharing network ;)
